result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
(6405) Case called at 305 pm. Defendant in court in custody via video with Michael Jude. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing for 22CF233 & 22CF290 with 21CF391 tracking; parties are prepared to proceed. State calls Deputy Sam Barett duly sworn by clerk and responds to direct exam of ADA Herrmann. Witness identifies defendant; record to reflect accurate ID of defendant. State's exhibit #1 for each file 22CF233 & 22CF290 previously marked offered and Id'd. No objection by defense subject to cross by defense atty Jude. 
313 pm Witness excused. State rests. Argument by State. Defense moves to dismiss. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed and matter bound over for trial. Record as to bond modification. Formal motion to be filed. Matter set over for arraignment on 22cf233 & 22CF290.
Arraignment scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.
**REASSIGNED TO KEEP ALL CO-DEFENDANT CASES ASSIGNED TO SAME COURT OFFICAL AFTER AUGUST 1 TRANSITION TO INTAKE.**
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher F McFadden in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Michael Jude in court for Christopher F McFadden. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Michael Jude

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher F McFadden in court, in custody by video. Attorney Obi Ozuwulu for defendant. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Cash bond filed. No signature from defendant.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher F McFadden in court, in custody by video. Attorney Jason Daane for bond purposes only. New total bond set. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

BOND TO COVER 22GF530, 22CF233 & 21CF391

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH TIMOTHY FIELDS OR JAMES WILLIAMS. NO CONTACT WITH STEPHANIE BARTLETT OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-2381 thru 22-2387
Further proceedings on June 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
